trans-unit.source: How to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your application to use Azure Active Directory login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your application to use Azure Active Directory login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Services to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Services to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Register your application with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Register your application with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Preview Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Preview Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Under Settings, click User authentication, and then click Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Under Settings, click User authentication, and then click Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Copy the App URL and the Reply URL listed there.
trans-unit.target: Copy the App URL and the Reply URL listed there.

trans-unit.source: You will use these later.
trans-unit.target: You will use these later.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the App URL and Reply URL are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the App URL and Reply URL are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal] and navigate to Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal] and navigate to Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Select your directory, and then select the Applications tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Select your directory, and then select the Applications tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click ADD at the bottom to create a new app registration.
trans-unit.target: Click ADD at the bottom to create a new app registration.

trans-unit.source: Click Add an application my organization is developing.
trans-unit.target: Click Add an application my organization is developing.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a Name for your application and click the Web Application And/Or Web API type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a Name for your application and click the Web Application And/Or Web API type.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: In the SIGN-ON URL box, paste the App ID you copied from the Active Directory identity provider settings of your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: In the SIGN-ON URL box, paste the App ID you copied from the Active Directory identity provider settings of your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Enter that same resource identifier in the App ID URI box.
trans-unit.target: Enter that same resource identifier in the App ID URI box.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: Once the application has been added, click the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the application has been added, click the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Edit the Reply URL under Single Sign-on to be the Mobile App Reply URL you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Edit the Reply URL under Single Sign-on to be the Mobile App Reply URL you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: It should be the Mobile App gateway appended with /signin-aad.
trans-unit.target: It should be the Mobile App gateway appended with /signin-aad.

trans-unit.source: For example, https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-aad.
trans-unit.target: For example, https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-aad.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Then copy the Client ID for the app.
trans-unit.target: Then copy the Client ID for the app.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Add Azure Active Directory information to your Mobile App
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Add Azure Active Directory information to your Mobile App

trans-unit.source: Return to the preview management portal and the Azure Active Directory settings blade for your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Return to the preview management portal and the Azure Active Directory settings blade for your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the Client ID setting for the Azure Active Directory identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the Client ID setting for the Azure Active Directory identity provider.

trans-unit.source: In the Allowed Tenants list, you need to add the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com).
trans-unit.target: In the Allowed Tenants list, you need to add the domain of the directory in which you registered the application (e.g. contoso.onmicrosoft.com).

trans-unit.source: You can find your default domain name by clicking the Domains tab on your Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: You can find your default domain name by clicking the Domains tab on your Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: Add your domain name to the Allowed Tenants list then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Add your domain name to the Allowed Tenants list then click Save.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Related Content
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Related Content

trans-unit.source: Authenticate users of your Mobile App with Azure Active Directory single sign-on: <link><linkText>iOS[ios-adal]</linkText><title></title></link>
